Comment:
Probably not a spectacular game, but the middle game is an example of positions in which you have to apply "deep strategic decisions". The situations in which you have three o four moves to choose and you don't have a clue about what do they lead... terrifying, even if everything seem to be plain and calm.
The endgame, an example of how sacrifying two pawns can lead to a victory on an almost stalled, almost but not zugzwang...
A classic example of my favorite system against a fianchetto. Hard to break, the black scheme up to here is one of the more solid against my opening.

This is a typical position of my white play. I must admit that it looks better for white if the BSB is not fianchettoed.
This is "my" attack. I assume I will castle queenside, and bring my rooks behind a pawns' storm.
"Developing" my queen would have been a mistake. It is ok where it is, taking advange of the d1-h5 diagonal.
"Developing" my queen would have been a mistake. It is ok where it is, taking advange of the d1-h5 diagonal.
Nd2-f3 was also possible. I was taking care of his Nc4...
Nd2-f3 was also possible. I was taking care of his Nc4...
The idea is to difficult f6 as a liberatory maneuver. After d4, Nf3 should be ok.
The idea is to difficult f6 as a liberatory maneuver. After d4, Nf3 should be ok.
Now, I lost the attention to c4 by defending e6. I should have seen that.
If Qd4, defending the pawn, Nxb3 with no compensation, since the knight can return to c4. Or maybe yes, by playing Rb1, Rb4... anyway. My dream of h5 vanishes.

Not that terrible. If Qe4+, Qe3 and all black has is to ruin my pawns... but not in the worst way.

The idea of Bb5 looks ok for black. I could have prevented it by a4, but I wanted to get rid of the annoying check in e4.
Now, b3 becomes impossible. I think it's the right moment to stop thinking in attacking and try to loosen pressure with a queen's exchange.

A mistake, since e6 stays unsupported by f7. And I had no real possibility to make any damage on the h column.
In order to free my knight. I am not sure about this move, tough.
What is doing this rook, there? Just preventing my Ra-h1?
